availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: George A. Rice (Campbellsville, Taylor County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier - Pvt. 13th Ky. Inf.)

body.p: Campbellsville, Taylor County, Kentucky, laborer. Kentucky native. Married to Ruthy Durrett Rice in Taylor County, Kentucky, on June 19, 1850. Father of Mary Rice, John Rice, James Rice, William Rice, and Daniel Rice. Tailor in Taylor County, Kentucky, in 1850. Laborer in Campbellsville, Taylor County, Kentucky, in 1860. Farmer in Taylor County in 1863. Served in the 13th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) as a private from December 30, 1861 to January 12, 1865.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Taylor County, District 2, p. 143B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Taylor County, Campbellsville, p. 626.
Consolidated Lists of Civil War Draft Registration Records, Records of the Provost Marshal General's Bureau (Civil War), NARA RG 110, Taylor County, KY, 1863, p. 431.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Taylor County Marriages, Film 000983727, p. 109.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 1, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), p. 864.
U.S. Headstones Provided for Deceased Union Civil War Veterans, 1861-1904NARA RG 92, Microfilm Series M1845.
